repo.description: Nvim Node.js client and plugin host
repo.name: node-client

body:
Closes #370 and #267

Introducing a new 'stopOnFirstMatch' option for the findNvim function, which helps reduce the number of system calls when the caller only need one valid match. Additionally, the search now includes common locations where Neovim might be installed.

comment_data.body: Can use a shorter name, the docstring clarifies any questions.
TODO: on Windows, this Set won't help much (need to normalize the slashes and perhaps drive letters).

I'm not sure this is right default install location for winget. I tested it on my window virtual machine and it turns out neovim was installed in `C:ProgramFiles\Neovim\bin`.

I also found [this](https://github.com/microsoft/winget-cli/blob/master/doc/specs/%23182%20-%20Support%20for%20installation%20of%20portable%20standalone%20apps.md) from their docs.

no need to use \ slashes, even on windows
```suggestion
    paths.add(normalizePath('C:/ProgramData/scoop/shims'));
```
It's worth a try, thanks for researching that! Would be good to mention that URL in the comment too.
the old logic supported callers that explicitly pass `minVersion = undefined`.

comment_regular_data.body: The codecov complaints about the Windows codepaths, should be fixed after https://github.com/neovim/node-client/pull/398
@justinmk Thanks for your patient review! This is my first time contributing to node-client, and I'm so excited.
It's great to have some help around here :)

repo.description: Nvim Node.js client and plugin host
repo.name: node-client

title: feat: add firstMatch option for findNvim
